page.title: 04EDUCATION IN BREICH VALLEY
page.content: In our area there is one nursery school,five primary schools and no secondary school. The{nursery school,}which is situated{in Stoneyburn,}takes pupils of 3-5 years from both Addiewell and Stoneyburn.For younger children who don't go to nursey school there is a pre-school playgroup three mornings a week in Addiewell Community Wing. Of the{5 primary schools}the smallest is Woodmuir which serves the village of Breich. It has only two teachers.Both Addiewell and Stoneyburn have two primary schools one of which is a Catholic school and one a non-denominational school.The oldest building is the R.C primary school in Stoneyburn which is pre-war.The others are fairly new. Secondary pupils travel to West Calder and Blackburn.
